column1: Role of natural killer cells in innate protection against lethal Ebola virus infection.
column3: I.p. or i.m. administration of non-replicating Ebola virus-like particles (VLP) containing the glycoprotein (GP) and matrix protein virus protein (VP40) induced protective immunity in mice challenged with Ebola virus. Innate protection against Ebola virus required NK cells. Ebola VLPs induced strong NK cytotoxic activity, as well as cytokine and chemokine secretion. NK cell-mediated protection against Ebola virus was perforin dependent, but did not depend on interferon-gamma secretion. Particles containing...

column1: A DNA vaccine for the prevention of Ebola virus infection.
column3: A DNA vaccine for the prevention of Ebola virus infection is reviewed with respect to: synthesis and SAR; preclinical development; toxicities; metabolism and pharmacokinetics; clinical development; and side effects and contraindications. Vaccines discussed are gamma-irradiated whole Ebola virus, inactivated Ebola virus, DNA vaccine, VRC-EBODNA012-00-VP, Vical's DNA vaccine, Ebola virus Zaire GP, Ebola virus Zaire GP and NP, Ebola virus DNA vaccine, rAd5-baed...

column1: Minireview. Ebola Virus Pathogenesis: implications for vaccines and therapies.
column3: The pathogenesis of the Ebola virus is reviewed with reference to implications for vaccines and therapies. Ebola virus disease progression, structure and classification of the Ebola virus, the immune response to Ebola virus infection and vaccine development are discussed. Live attenuated viruses and recombinant proteins have been used successfully in many experimental Ebola virus vaccines. However, gene-based vaccines are becoming an increasingly attractive option. DNA vaccines have been highly effective...

column1: Accelerated vaccination for Ebola virus haemorrhagic fever in non-human primates.
column3: I.m. vaccination with adenoviral (ADV) vector encoding the Ebola glycoprotein (GP) or nucleoprotein (NP) protected monkeys against lethal challenge with Ebola virus infection. Protection was highly effective and was correlated with the generation of Eloba-specific CD8+ T-cell and Ab responses. Even a single ADV-GP/NP injection protected against viral challenge. Results suggest that this accelerated vaccine provides an intervention that may help to limit the epidemic spread of Ebola, and is applicable to other viruses.

column1: Treatment of Ebola virus infection with a recombinant inhibitor of factor VIIa/tissue factor: a study in rhesus monkeys.
column3: In a rhesus macaque model of Ebola hemorrhagic fever, s.c. recombinant nematode anticoagulant protein c2 (rNAPc2), a potent...factor-initiated blood coagulation, administered 10 min or 24 hr after lethal injection of Ebola virus prolonged survival time. RNAPc2 attenuated the coagulation response. Furthermore...in the treated than the untreated macaques. Post-exposure protection with rNAPc2 against Ebola virus in primates provides a new foundation for therapeutic regimens that target the disease...

column1: Recombinant Vesicular Stomatitis Virus-Based Vaccines Against Ebola and Marburg Virus Infections.
column3: Recombinant vesicular stomatitis virus-based vaccines against Ebola and Marburg virus infections are reviewed with reference to: Ebola and Marburg viruses; recombinant vesicular stomatitis virus as a vaccine vector for filoviruses; recombinant vesicular...vesicular stomatitis virus-based filovirus vaccines. column1: Inhibition of Ebola Virus Replication In-Vitro and in a SCID Mouse Model by S-Adenosylhomocysteine Hydrolase Inhibitors.
column3: In-vitro, antiviral activity of S-adenosylhomocysteine hydrolase inhibitors against Ebola hemorrhagic fever virus was assessed in Vero E-6 or FRL-103 cells by monoclonal ELISA...only the immune-deficient SCID mouse produced a lethal infection. column1: Preparation and use of hyperimmune serum for prophylaxis and therapy of Ebola virus infections.
column3: Anti-Ebola virus immunoglobulins obtained from goats were used to treat 4 subjects suspected of being infected with the Ebola virus. In 3 cases, the i.m. immunoglobulin injections were combined with injections of recombinant alpha-2-interferon. The case of 1 subject is described in detail. This subject had a suspected case of accidental Ebola virus infection and was given anti-Ebola virus goat immunoglobulin. He completely recovered, but it was unclear whether...

column1: Protective efficacy of neutralizing antibodies against Ebola virus infection.

Ab treatment in guinea pigs...as in mice, single-dose treatment of guinea pigs 1 day before, or 1 or 2 days after i.p. Ebola virus challenge did protect some animals. column1: Treatment of lethal Ebola virus infection in mice with a single dose of an S-adenosyl- L-homocysteine hydrolase inhibitor.
column3: The effect was studied of a single inoculation of carbocyclic 3-deazaadenosine (C-c3Ado; 3-deazaaristeromycin) or 3-deazaneplanocin-A in mice challenged with Ebola-Zaire virus. The drugs protected mice from virus challenge, without causing acute toxicity. Single or multiple doses of the same medications suppressed Ebola replication in severe combined immunodeficient mice (SCID), repeated daily treatment did not eliminate the infection. It is suggested that these compounds may form part of a regimen for the treatment of Ebola virus.
